title: The Intelligence - “A great stock of political capital has been burned through at remarkable speed”—England’s lockdown
summary:
Also on the daily podcast: Facebook’s role in Myanmar’s election and examining the glut of political biographiesPRIME MINISTER BORIS JOHNSON all but ruled out a second lockdown, but his hand has been forced by England’s caseload.
What are the political costs of his U-turn?
Myanmar’s coming election will almost certainly be marred by disinformation on Facebook—principally because so many Burmese people get their only news there.
And examining the current glut of political biographies.
Runtime: 20minListen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google | Stitcher | TuneInFor full access to print, digital and audio editions of The Economist, subscribe here www.economist.com/intelligenceoffer
paragraphs: Also on the daily podcast: Facebook’s role in Myanmar’s election and examining the glut of political biographies

PRIME MINISTER BORIS JOHNSON all but ruled out a second lockdown, but his hand has been forced by England’s caseload. What are the political costs of his U-turn? Myanmar’s coming election will almost certainly be marred by disinformation on Facebook—principally because so many Burmese people get their only news there. And examining the current glut of political biographies. Runtime: 20min
